page.title: 05A walk through the grid IV
page.content: In the distance to our left we could see the A35 ,the Railway line on its embankment, and Roeshot Hill. As we walked on we came into Housing once again . Bungalows to our left and a few shops to our right. These shops were called Saulflands. From the car park in front of the shops we could see the back of our school. To get there we had to continue along Smugglers Lane, then turn left into Forest Way and then take the third left into Parkside. By the time that we returned the coaches that would take the pupils home were waiting in front of the school car park and there was an ice cream van paked by the main gate. We had walked nearly 4.5 miles and it had taken just under 2 hours. The weather was good . The date Wednesday 3rd July, 1985.
